page.title: 11A CANAL WALK FROM SILSDEN
page.content: Four boys from class 6 walked along the towpath from Silsden on July 4th, 1985. {Damon}saw these boats: four hire craft, five cabin-cruisers, three maintenance barges, a speedboat, a rowing boat and several canoes. One boat was 'en route' from Sheffield to London. {David}saw seven fishermen, six walkers, a jogger and a cyclist, who had joined the canal at Shipley. Two ramblers from Manchester had walked along every part of the canal. {Jonathan}looked at wild life. He noted mallards with chicks, swans, lapwings and eight types of wild flowers. {Shawn}looked for pollution. He thought the canal looked clean and colourful. He did find some waste paper, tin cans and polythene bags but little oil. All the boys enjoyed their walk.
